Hackbook: Macbook Pro laptop running Debian

I am not very happy with Debian, because it is so messy, too much things running in the background, systemd, dbus, a whole lot of background tasks i have no idea what they are doing and have no conscious recollection of installing. Anyway, it runs pretty good on an old macbook which BSD didn't

Some dotfiles are here on github

List of software I like

  • wmii; very simple tiling window manager
  • vim (see dotfiles above for plugin-list & vimrc)
  • Firefox, with plugins:
    • vim-vixen
    • umatrix
    • ghostery
    • tree style tabs
